name: treatment of used refrigerant R12, venting | used refrigerant R12 | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20866/documentation

This dataset represents treatment of used refrigerant R-12 by venting.;The refrigerant R-12 was a widely used refrigerant (mainly in automobile) and as aerosol spray propellant. It can be treated by two different technologies; 1) venting, and 2) final disposal. ;R-12 is included in the list of  "venting prohibition" under (ยง82.154, subpart F) under section 608 of the Clean Air Act in USA. ;Reference: US EPA, accessed at https://www.epa.gov/section608/stationary-refrigeration-prohibition-venting-refrigerants, on 4/4/2018).

The activity starts, when the used refrigerant is accepted for treatment.

No energy is used during this process.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3822:Treatment and disposal of hazardous waste

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Venting refers to releasing of the R-12 refrigerant to air. R-12 production was banned with the Montreal Protocol with this decision being in effect globally since 2010. Due to that, it is assumed that there is no reclaiming of R-12 around the globe.

flow.name: used refrigerant R12
flow.category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3822:Treatment and disposal of hazardous waste

exchanges.description:
Calculated value.

It is assumed, that all the refrigerant is vented into air.
